title: JAM ORB / stas-rajko
description: You can examine and appreciate this car with Kim.

dialogueTree.title: Encyclopedia: "A Stas-Rajko! One of the finest Zsi..."
dialogueTree.text: A Stas-Rajko! One of the finest Zsiemsk-made motor carriages ever. An oldie but a goldie.

links.title: You: "Who drives these?"
links.text: Who drives these?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Not many people outside of Graad –..."
links.text: Not many people outside of Graad – and Revachol West too, it appears.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Bulky frame. Heavy. Hardy. Looks li..."
links.text: Bulky frame. Heavy. Hardy. Looks like a tractor.

links.title: You: "Hold up. Is this a tractor?"
links.text: Hold up. Is this a tractor?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Yes, built like a tractor. And used..."
links.text: Yes, built like a tractor. And used as one too in the Zsiemsk countryside! Take note of the Eight Antler emblem, the symbol of the Stas-Rajko. Proudly born to honour its humble roots.

links.title: You: "What a beautiful motor carriage! I..."
links.text: What a beautiful motor carriage! I want to know more!

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Glad to share! The value of the mot..."
links.text: Glad to share! The value of the motor carriage has been seriously diminished by its colour: all Stas-Rajkos are baby-blue by default. The paint would be considered unforgivable to collectors.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Zaffer blue was also the colour Zyg..."
links.text: Zaffer blue was also the colour Zygismunt the Great used for his banners... Strange. This is really all you know about the Stas-Rajko. And ancient Zsiemsk rulers.

links.title: You: ""Hey Kim, check this out!""
links.text: "Hey Kim, check this out!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A Stas-Rajko, KK-2. That's a class..."
links.text: "A Stas-Rajko, KK-2. That's a classic model," the lieutenant replies with a nod. "Never thought I'd see another one repainted after what happened last time."

links.title: You: "Hold on, maybe I can impress him --..."
links.text: Hold on, maybe I can impress him -- do *I* know what happened last time?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "No. Only that the motor carriage is..."
links.text: No. Only that the motor carriage is typically baby-blue, the colours of Zygismunt the Great, an ancient Zsiemsk ruler. His banners were famously zaffer and white: the colours of the Stas-Rajko.

links.title: You: ""Let me guess what happened last ti..."
links.text: "Let me guess what happened last time, Kim: Blue and white are the colours of Zsiemsk. Someone painted it, got a Zsiemsk mad, and boom -- murder happened."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's... Well, yes. Exactly it, m..."
links.text: "That's... Well, yes. Exactly it, more or less. Except it was a crowd of them. Tore him out of the vehicle and ran him over with his own tyres."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They said it was an honour killing..."
links.text: "They said it was an honour killing. Hussar-style. The Zsiemsk community protested the trial, flying the colours." He shakes his head. "Five thousand came to protest."

links.title: You: ""What happened last time, Kim?""
links.text: "What happened last time, Kim?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""An old case from my precinct. A co..."
links.text: "An old case from my precinct. A couple of Zsiemsk migrants saw a Stas-Rajko stopped in the street, painted just like this: muddy brown. Murdered the driver on the spot."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They said it was an honour killing..."
links.text: "They said it was an honour killing. Hussar-style. The Zsiemsk community protested the trial, flying the banners of some old king or whatever." He shakes his head. "Five thousand came to protest."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Correction: four-thousand-three-hun..."
links.text: Correction: four-thousand-three-hundred-and-ninety-five. The fourth largest public protest of a criminal trial in Revachol.

links.title: You: ""Hate to correct you Kim, but only..."
links.text: "Hate to correct you Kim, but only four-thousand-three-hundred-and-ninety-five people were on that protest."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is that so, officer? I'll take you..."
links.text: "Is that so, officer? I'll take you at your word."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Were you there?"
links.text: Were you there?

links.title: You: ""Who are the Zsiemsk community?""
links.text: "Who are the Zsiemsk community?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""People we're paid to protect." The..."
links.text: "People we're paid to protect." The lieutenant shakes his head. "Let's leave it at that."

links.title: You: ""What'd they sentence the killers t..."
links.text: "What'd they sentence the killers to?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He studies his reflection in the ca..."
links.text: He studies his reflection in the car window. "Four years for murder in Reunion."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shrugs. "The perps w..."
links.text: The lieutenant shrugs. "The perps were remorseful. Their *sorry* knocked eight years off the sentence. That's the system."

links.title: Logic: "The prisons in the Greater Revachol..."
links.text: The prisons in the Greater Revachol Industrial Harbour are already full. Prisoners are expensive to maintain. The longer the sentence, the larger the cost.

links.title: You: ""Kim... could our hanged man have b..."
links.text: "Kim... could our hanged man have been the driver of this car?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Could it be another Stas-Rajko mur..."
links.text: "Could it be another Stas-Rajko murder?" He gives you a crooked smile. "Honestly, that just doesn't seem like the type of vehicle our dead guy would drive, so my initial guess is the two are not related."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Could it be another Stas-Rajko mur..."
links.text: "Could it be another Stas-Rajko murder?" He gives you a crooked smile. "You really should ask me to brief you on the case. But right now I'm just gonna go ahead and guess the two aren't related."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I try to avoid drawing far-gone co..."
links.text: "I try to avoid drawing far-gone conclusions like this before actually examining the body," the lieutenant says with a slight smirk. "But my initial guess is the two are unrelated."

links.title: You: ""Interesting. Before we proceed, I'..."
links.text: "Interesting. Before we proceed, I've got an *opinion* on this paint-job."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, detective?""
links.text: "Yes, detective?"

links.title: You: ""I think it looks better brown and..."
links.text: "I think it looks better brown and black."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay." The lieutenant takes his gl..."
links.text: "Okay." The lieutenant takes his glasses off to polish. "I'm not going to honour kill anyone over this -- but I've *seen* it blue and white. It's much better that way."

links.title: You: ""They should've left it baby-blue.""
links.text: "They should've left it baby-blue."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You sure you're not Zsiemsk?" He s..."
links.text: "You sure you're not Zsiemsk?" He shares a smile with you, only for a second.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Yes, you're sure you're not! Or if..."
links.text: Yes, you're sure you're not! Or if you are, it's only in that Revacholian way. (Four to five percent maximum.)

links.title: You: "Got it. [Finish thought.]"
links.text: Got it. [Finish thought.]

links.title: You: "That's cool, but I have policeman t..."
links.text: That's cool, but I have policeman things to do. [Discard thought.]
